metadata.title: CVE-2021-47605 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:vduse: fix memory corruption in vduse_dev_ioctl()The "config.offset" comes from the user.  There needs to a check toprevent it being out of bounds.  The "config.offset" and"dev->config_size" variables are both type u32.  So if the offset ifout of bounds then the "dev->config_size - config.offset" subtractionresults in a very high u32 value.  The out of bounds offset can resultin memory corruption.
